title: Ticket #1360: startd hangs when fetch hook reads stdin a certain way
description: With fetch hook using Perl on Windows, when doing a read from stdin it works, but when calling the join function on the stdin file handle (see fetch.pl -vs- fetchold.pl), it fails about 50-75%. When it fails, the startd is dead until killed/restarted.
remarks:
2010-May-20 05:01:14 by mtmoore:
I found a simple test case that causes startd to hang requiring it to be killed hard. As before, the fetch hook in testing is invoking a bat file that runs a perl script. To re-create the issue create a simple perl script like below that tries to use a non-existent module.

Startd Log

   05/19 16:54:34 Executable is a batch file, running: "C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /Q /C "C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.bat"
   05/19 16:54:34 GetBinaryType() returned 0
   05/19 16:54:34 Create_Process(): executable: 'C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.bat'
   05/19 16:54:34 Executable is a batch file, running: "C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe" /Q /C "C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.bat"
   05/19 16:54:34 GetBinaryType() returned 0
   05/19 16:54:34 DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd 65537 (errno = 22).  Aborting write attempts.
   05/19 16:54:34 DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd 65539 (errno = 22).  Aborting write attempts.
   05/19 16:54:34 DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite: Unable to write to fd 65542 (errno = 22).  Aborting write attempts.
   05/19 16:54:34 HookClient C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.bat (pid 5140) exited with status 0
   05/19 16:54:34 Warning, hook C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.bat (pid 5140) printed to stderr: Can't locate Foo/Bar.pm in @INC (@INC contains: C:/perl/site/lib C:/perl/lib .) at C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.pl line 5. BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at C:\condor\libexec\vbox\fetch.pl line 5.

The perl script (fetch.pl) that generated the error is: 

   #!/usr/bin/perl
   use strict;
   use warnings;


   use Foo::Bar;


   exit 0;

2010-May-25 10:10:22 by mtmoore:
I have been able to create the same symptom through a different path. When a fetch hook retrieves work for a slot that is already running a fetched job startd hangs. As soon as the FetchWorkDelay occurs I can no longer talk to the host's startd and must kill it manually. For testing I set it to 120 seconds. The fetch hook is running on all 4 slots. For some reason this fetch hook is also triggering the 'DaemonCore::PidEntry::pipeFullWrite' error.

Config snippet: 

    STARTD_JOB_HOOK_KEYWORD = VBOX
    VBOX_HOOK_DIR = C:\condor\libexec\vbox
    VBOX_HOOK_FETCH_WORK = $(VBOX_HOOK_DIR)\fetch.bat
    VBOX_HOOK_PREPARE_JOB = $(VBOX_HOOK_DIR)\prepare.bat
    VBOX_HOOK_EVICT_CLAIM = $(VBOX_HOOK_DIR)\exit.bat
    VBOX_HOOK_JOB_EXIT = $(VBOX_HOOK_DIR)\exit.bat
    RANK = ifThenElse( isUndefined(VBoxSlot), 1, 0 )
    FetchWorkDelay = ifThenElse(State == "Claimed", 120, 120)

I have the fetch hook defined as a bat file that runs the following perl script: 

    #!/usr/bin/perl
    use strict;
    use warnings;


    print STDOUT << "EOF";
        JobUniverse = 5
        Owner = "mtmoore"
        User = "mtmoore\@clemson.edu"
        NiceUser = TRUE
        Cmd = "C:\\condor\\libexec\\vbox\\run.bat"
        Args = "mtmoore"
        Iwd = "D:\\CondorVM"
        Out = "vbox.mtmoore.out"
        Err = "vbox.mtmoore.err"
        StarterUserLog = "vbox.mtmoore.user.log"
        StarterUserLogUseXML = FALSE
        JobLeaseDuration = 604800
        Requirements = TRUE
    EOF
    exit 0;

The run.bat file runs the following perl script: 

    #!/usr/bin/perl
    use strict;
    use warnings;
    use File::Spec;


    while ( 1 )
    {
        sleep 5;
    }
    exit 0;
